item.title: Report E-2023060505
item.description:
Report E-2023060505

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: LEHIGHTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Lewis Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due to a loose cap on a 275-gallon poly tote. Lewis Environmental personnel replaced the cap and seal and neutralized the impacted area with Kolar Safe. The neutralized material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The packages impacted by the released material were food grade product and terminal personnel placed the cargo into the dumpster. Enviroserve The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: YORK
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The 55 gallon drum in temporary storage at Veolia's PA 10-day intransit facility when it suddenly reacted, causing the drum to rupture. All of the contents of the drum release from the drum into secondary containment in the waste storage area. While there were employees that were nearby when this occurred, there were no injuries and no exposures. The pH of the liquid was tested and was found to be between 12 and 13. This was the only drum in the shipment. Veolia contacted a third party emergency response company to clean up the spill and decontaminate the area.

item.title: Report E-2023060340
item.description:
Report E-2023060340

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: PITTSBURGH
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAQ experienced a UN3264 Reaxis S 50 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 100-gallons of product released to an 8' x 15' area of the trailer floor and to the asphalt lot below due to a pallet puncture. The product was transferred into a new tote. Soda ash and absorbents were utilized to clean the impacted areas along with other impacted freight. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized. All waste was placed into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-12
  • City: Aliquippa
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 05/12/2023, at 1535 hours, personnel in the CSXT Aliquippa Yard discovered PPRX 55120, a loaded tank car of Pentanes, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the Shipper, National Response Center, and Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Protection were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2023-0512-00223). Specialized Professional Services, Inc, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the liquid valve primary flanged connection to the fittings plate was observed with 2 of 4 securement nuts less than tool tight. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Tim Nelson, phone 346.312.9881. Contractor personnel relieved all vapor pressure from the car, tightened all securement nuts. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. Cause Code: 270 NARRI: 100

item.description:

  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A forklift operator was loading 2 pallets, of UN1133 into trailer 88996 at dock door 85. A forklift arm punctured one box, which contained 2 metal buckets that the OS on site advised were roughly 5 gallons each. The OS advised that at least one of the buckets was punctured and that the entire conten ts of the bucket leaked out. One of the yard workers noticed liquid leaking from screw holes in the side of the trailer. The workers on site put powder down to soak up what was leaking on the trailer and most of the spill was contained quickly once it was noticed. The liquid that dripped out of the side of the trailer dripped onto blacktop. The OS advised that they would place everything in a recovery drum after letting the powder do its job. The OS did not feel they needed a spill crew called out, I advised that if that changed to call me back.

item.description:
Report X-2023050277

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: After the package was verified and processed it was moved to be loaded onto trailer for transport to HUB. Package Handlers alerted SR Ops Admin clerk, James (2820862) that they suspected it was leaking. Upon inspection by James it was determined to have been leaking due to Puncture on sidewall of one plastic bottle. James transported package to HazMat Cage and secured it in Red Salvage Tub. At the end of the shift he processed the DPR and sent an email to myself to do the HESS Report as he did not have time before the building was closed and his shift ended. DescribePack: Punctured sidewall of one plastic gallon jug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Plastic Jug placed inside plastic heavy-duty bag and placed entire content in Red Salvage Tub.

item.title: Report E-2023050096
item.description:
Report E-2023050096

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and a 2ft-by-2ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released due to load shift during transit. Hepaco personnel removed all the cargo from the trailer and confirmed that only two (2) 1-gallon plastic jugs were crushed and approximately twelve (12) boxes were impacted by the released material. Hepaco personnel neutralized the impacted areas and deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and collected the spent absorbents and placed them into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and placed an impacted pallet, cardboard, and debris into an additional 55-gallon poly drum and both drums were staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing. The nondamaged cargo was shipped on to the consignee. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
